dct_title_s: Effigies ampli Regni auriferi Guineae in Africa siti, extensum inde ad insulis Atlanticis, vulgo dictis, de Cabo Verde
dct_description_sm: delineata per S. Rovelascum, et politioribus lineainentis figurata per Lodouicum Texeram, protocosmographum Regis Hispaniarum ; Baptista Doetechomius sculpsit.
2 bar scales on map, given in "Miliaria Germanica" (100 units [=9 cm]); and "Hispanicæ leucæ."
Latitudinal and longitudinal lines along margin.
Decorative border and cartouches, compass roses, rhumb lines, ships, sea monster.
"Eodem anno editus est liber, amplam harum regionum descriptionem continens per P.D.M."
2 pictorial insets depicting activities of the natives of Guinea, with explanations below.
Based on the manuscript map by Luis Teixeira; originally published by Cornelis Claesz , approximately 1602.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
